>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.PU3uwrAcmGXMGo2n]{Specialization}

You can steal or adopt new identities as easily as most people change clothes, allowing you to infiltrate nearly any circle.

Associated Skills: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.GcVVfpQ79HdcMqBt]{Bluff} and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.aayAhTaRzitONs5U]{Disguise}. When you use Bluff to make a trick attack, you gain a +4 bonus to the skill check.

Specialization Exploit: @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.92c1eOFEI5CQy2y4]{Master of Disguise (Ex)}

@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.OZFrExqqPTTzAMeT]{Fool Detection (Ex)}:At 11th level, whenever you succeed at a saving throw against a spell, technological device, or ability that would provide information about you (such as @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.spells.Item.moyeAHT4yzZVWmmg]{Detect Thoughts}), instead of negating the effect, you can provide false information that matches your cover identity. If such an effect has no saving throw, you can attempt a Bluff check opposed by the Sense Motive check of the caster or user, and provide similar false information on a success.

Free Skill Ranks from Specialization's associated skills are auto applied in the modifiers tab
